? A mistake in reply, 18. Nc4+! gives White the advantage. 18...Ka6 19. Ne5! forces Black to give up the Queen with 19...Qxe6 20. Bxe6 Nxe6. Material is even but White has an development advantage and Black has an exposed king

21. Nxc2 exd3 (for some reason the comp does not want to take the pawn even though I think it is best.) 22.Bf1 b6 23. Nb4+ Kb7 24.Nxd3 is a pawn up for White.

but all hope is not lost for Black. His king is safe and White's pieces are all of the sudden all behind the 4th rank.

24...e6 is the best way to stay in. Now Black has possible threats like ...Qe4 and Bb4+
In a way the roles are reversed.
